text: 0,33l bottle at home. For some reason my bottle seems to say BB 01/2016 (according to google translate), havent even had it that long. light gusher but quite strong carbonation, brown / redish hazy color, quite big off white head. smells of resin, a bit glueish, lightly fruity. rather good smell. medium to full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes of resin, lightly fruity, a bit soapy, hints of caramel, light veggies, lightly earthy, spices. finishes lightly bitter with notes of resin and light dark fruits. quite enjoyable, very light veggie notes (which I assume are there because my bottle isnt the freshest anymore), but overall still great to drink.

33cl bottle, bought at De Bierkoning, Amsterdam and consumed on 07-July-2016. Hazy reddish brown in colour with a really thick beige coloured head. Fizzy pour and lively. Aroma of sweet fruit, molasses and spices. Medium body. Slightly sweet, lightly hopped - fruity and slightly tart. Molasses, cinnamon, caramel malt and an alcohol buzz. Character of a sweet pale ale.
Bottle at home. Pours hazy brown with a medium off-white head. Aroma has some fruitiness, grassh, bit of caramel. Taste has some caramel, malts and a medium bitter finish. Medium body and carbo.

Collab of no less than seven breweries, including Elysian and Lucky Bastard. Quite strong gusher. Very thick and rocky, pale yellowish beige, irregular, coarse head over a hazy brownish copper coloured beer, notably darker than the average steam beer, as which this is apparently intended. Pleasant aroma of raisins, gingerbread, overripe pear, biscuit, cake dough, soap, brown sugar, cinnamon, apricot, Haagse hopjes, gin, cocoa powder, dry earth, white pepper, banana, apple peel, marmelade, cloves. Medium sweetish onset, estery with hints of raspberry, pear and banana, fluffy mouthfeel with medium to sharpish carbonation, bit minerally, sourish elderberry accent, soft caramelly and nutty malt sweetness with bittering toasted edge while the esters as well as some spicy phenols keep playing around; finishes with a pleasant, earthy and spicy hop bitterness, rooty yeastiness and lingering malt sweetness, but also some badly hidden, slightly astringent alcohol and glueish solvents making it a bit more harsh than it should have been. Still an interesting and enjoyable beer though, perhaps stretching the limits of California common too far and showing even some Belgian traits in spite of the use of steam beer yeast and American hops.
33cl bottle. Pours dirty hazy deep orange golden colour with a very big beige head. Aroma of spicy malt, bitter hops, red malt. Taste of mild bitter spicy hops, green tea, high carbonation.
Large white mokka coloured head, chestnut coloured body, hoppy fruity strawberry peaches, sweet hoppy acid taste, medium to large carbonation medium to high bitter

Bière de collaboration entre 7 brasseries ( impressionnant...), et donc hormis notre néerlandaise, on trouve 
une espagnole, une allemande, une polonaise, une tchèque, une africaine du sud, et une américaine des States (Elysian). 4 malts (pils, carared, mélanoidin, et abbaye), 4 houblons(Summit, Simcoe, Cascade, Citra), et la recette est la même pour les 7 brasseries, sauf en ce qui concerne la levure employée. Ici, Vandestreek a choisi la levure dune california common ou de la steambeer de chez Anchor. Niveau abv de 6,5 %. Mon exemplaire était juste à date.
Bière très technique donc, et dans ce cadre on doit être très exigeant....
Couleur brun roux châtain foncé.
Grand mélange de matière, dû à une très forte carbonation à louverture (plus de 3 minutes pour évacuer le surplus!!!).
Bulles fines partout, mais pas très nombreuses.
Mousse brun clair épaisse, qui forme un nappage à flocons moyens, stable à 2 mm.
Arômes de fruits exo, fût de vin, pointe de rhum et cuberdon.
1ère bouche soyeuse à la très belle entame fruits exo/fût.
Arrière-bouche très accentuée liqueur, avec une amertume pointue, pointe de citron vert.
2ème au grand fondu des saveurs.
Arrière-bouche sur les fruits exo, et une amertume complexe.
3ème vraiment jolie avec des herbes et épices.
Arrière-bouche qui travaille lamertume, très savante.
Longueur très fine, complexe, et surtout très belle.
Jambes fines, serrées, groupées.
Levure pointue, fine, belle ligne.
Alcool très correct pour le genre, il souligne toutes les qualités du produit, et gère lensemble avec une belle maîtrise.
Finale qui nous surprend encore avec des découvertes.
CONCLUSION : on finit par regretter le visuel de la bière, parce que tout le reste est impeccable.
Cette équipe a concocté une grande recette, et la levure de Vandestreek était bien choisie pour la mettre en valeur. On ne comprend donc pas cette carbonation à tout va, et on la regrette amèrement (sans jeu de mots), parce quelle interdit le top dun cheveu... La barre était placée très haut aussi,
à cause de la technicité ...
Foam fountain, pitty as it is worth every drop. Dark orange, tanned lasting, lacing foam head. Nice hoppy aroma and bitter taste. (Velp 201512)

330ml bottle. Slightly cloudy, dark copper-ish, chestnut colour with huge, firm, frothy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, beige head. Spicy herbal, grassy hoppy, and nuttily malty aroma, hints of gooseberry and plum. Taste is minimally sweet caramel malty, a nuttily wafer touch, slightly dry, fruity hoppy overtones, hints of red berries, plum, slightly bitter fruit parings. Nicely diversified, in the end equalised battle of bitter vs. sweet resp. ascending vs. gravitating combatants.

33cl Bottle from Slijterij Wijnhandel Meijer, Egmond a/Zee. Gusher, although I must say I just purchased it, and drank it without cooling first. Murky chestnut brown colour, fizzy light-beige head. Aroma of toast, light floral note, roasted malts, some (burnt) caramel, slight veggie note. Flavour is medium sweet, caramel, light roast, toast, sweet nuts, citrus, light veggies, bitter finish, sticky. Medium bodied at best, over-carbonated.

33cl. Bottle. 
Pours cloudy brown with big off white head. 
Aroma tropical fruits, citrus, some yeast, caramel. 
Taste tropical citrus spicy bitter, some caramel sweets. 
Mouthfeel bit creamy. 
Great beer.

Bottle shared thanks to Deanso. Pours cloudy brown with a massive tan head. Aroma of tropical fruit, light weedy and grassy hops, peach, a little citrus and caramel malt. Flavour is moderate sweet and over moderate bitter. Medium bodied with fairly high carbonation.

Bottle. Amber, hazy, average to large and mostly lasting head. Moderate, malty and sweetish aroma, light - some caramel and light tropical - floral fruitiness, faint citrus hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and lightly sweetish - sweetish flavor, light - some caramel and light tropical fruitiness, light citrus hoppyness. Finish is short to average, malty and lightly sweetish, light caramel and fruitiness, light - some citrus/herbal hoppyness. Sweetish ale with caramel  nothing special. Nice head though.

33cl bottle at home. Hazy amber brown with a medium slightly off-white soapy head. Medium body with moderate carbonation. Medium bitterness with some fruity sweetness. Pine, grapefruit, malts, caramel, brown sugar and herbs. A tasty hoppy brew.
Bottle. Red copper color, white head. Aroma of dry grassy yeast and hop. Taste is dry and grassy, with copper, caramalt, yeast and some herbal hops. Not bad, but also not very interesting.

Bottle at home. Clear mahogany with very big fluffy light beige head. Grapefruit, cookies, tangerine, knackebrod, herbs, light pine. Light sweet with medium bitterness throughout. Medium bodied. Looks very nice and has a very nice balance between the herbal hops and complex maltyness. Enjoyable.

(vandeStreek bier GlobAle) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a teku, ABV 6.5%

Dee p amber coloured beer with a huge head on top, thick and creamy, light beige in colour.
Aroma has citrus, grapefruit, light orange peel, caramel malts.
Nice taste, hoppy enough, citrus, more grapefruit now, orange peel, light tangerine, grains and pine. Quite bitter.
Medium thin body with good carbonation.
NIce one.
Aroma of malt, caramel, earthy notes, hint of sugar, red fruits, hops. Flavour is moderate sweet with a moderate bitter finish. Decent beer with some hops and a sweetish malty/fruity character.

33cl bottle from ABCBeers
Thick creamy white head. Clear amber pour. Nice bitterness. Easy drinking.
Tap at BFG15. Another steam beer with a lot of hops. Too much hops, seems more an IPA than a steam beer. For me no successful combination. steam beer (lager) and the hops.

bottle sample, poured a cloudy amber colour with a white head, spicy herbal notes upfront, yeast, malts, and some hints of citrus, floral notes, caramel sweetness in the and, average carbonated. bit of a spicy finish. average brew

Bottle @ weekly tasting shared with Joes. Lightly unclear orange to lightly reddish color with some yeast residu floating in it, huge off-white head that lasts for a long time. Aroma has malts and slightly some hops. Taste lightly malts, lightly hops, somehow a hint of caramel, softly bitter. Pretty nicely done imo.

33cl bottle at home from De Bierkoning, Amsterdam. Body is hazy deep amber, head is big, off-white, creamy, mostly lasting, excellent lacing. Nose is spicy, flavor is herbs, fruity, brown sugar, candy sweets. Medium sweet, light bitter, sour. Finish is medium lasting fruity sweet-sour, light hoppy bitter. Medium body, sticky texture, average carbonation. Easy, refreshing, tasty, interesting.

The concept of this beer alone merits attention. Smells like an IPA, but is much more subtle in taste, almost has a dry chalky quality, even some flavors you can find in a schwarz. Very enjoyable.

Bottle from De Zwart in Wilnis

330 ml Bottle
Appearance: Hazy orange (with reddish hints) with a slightly offwhite head which has a ok retention and leaves some lacing.
Aroma: citric hops and caramel malts. 
Taste: Light-moderate bitterness , caramel malts and citric hops, suprisingly some alcohol in the finish, which make it a bit boozy for 6.5% ABV.
medium body, sticky texture, average carbonation.

Ok, and the concept is interresting and I might see if I can hunt down another one to see how they compare.

Bottle, pours ruby red with an off white head. Floral, citrus, slightly burnt caramel, hop oils, orange, wood. Medium sweet and bitter, sticky texture, medium body, medium long, caramel, hop and slightly boozy finish.
Bottle. Dark amber color. Red fruit and soft floral notes in the aroma. Malty sweetish flavor with floral notes, red fruit, hopoil. Hints of caramel and citrus. tannines. Decent.

Bottle @ Rooie Dop Brewdungeon Exit party. The aroma has citric hops and caramel malts. Bit hazy, orange -red coloured beer with a slight off-white head. The taste is light-moderate bitter, has caramel malt sweetness. Not dry all the way, has some stickyness. Well brewed.
Bottle @ Rooie Dop, large sample. Slight hazy copper color, medium off-white head. Aroma is quite hoppy, slight caramel malt. Medium bitter in taste. Nice stuff.
